back_cards.definition_en: A result or consequence of an action
back_cards.example_en: The new policy had a positive effect on sales.
Her speech had a profound effect on the audience.
The medicine’s effect was immediate.

back_cards.definition_en: A visual or sound feature in media
back_cards.example_en: The movie used special effects to create explosions.
The law will take effect next month.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of the year with distinct weather
back_cards.example_en: Autumn is my favorite season for hiking.

back_cards.definition_en: A time for a specific activity or event
back_cards.example_en: The holiday season is busy for retailers.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of a TV show’s episodes
back_cards.example_en: The new season of the series premieres tonight.
Farmers prepare for the planting season in spring.

back_cards.definition_en: A phase of life or experience
back_cards.example_en: This season of her life was full of growth.

back_cards.definition_en: A financial charge imposed by the government
back_cards.example_en: She paid her income tax before the deadline.
The project was a tax on their resources.

back_cards.definition_en: A fee on specific goods or services
back_cards.example_en: The sales tax increased the cost of the item.
The property tax funded local schools.

back_cards.definition_en: A demand on time or effort
back_cards.example_en: Caring for the children was a tax on her energy.
The doctor checked her heart with a stethoscope.

back_cards.definition_en: The center or core of something
back_cards.example_en: The heart of the city is its historic district.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol of love or emotion
back_cards.example_en: He drew a heart on the card for her.
She put her heart into the performance.

back_cards.definition_en: The essence or most important part
back_cards.example_en: The heart of the issue was communication.
Her son is studying at university.
The family business was passed to the son.

back_cards.definition_en: A term of affection for a young man
back_cards.example_en: Come here, son, let me help you.

back_cards.definition_en: A person associated with a place or group
back_cards.example_en: He was a son of the village, born and raised there.
The artist was a son of the Renaissance style.
Her art was displayed in a local gallery.
Cooking is an art he mastered over years.
She majored in art at college.
The museum showcased modern art.
The art of negotiation helped close the deal.

back_cards.definition_en: Able to happen or be done
back_cards.example_en: It’s possible to finish the project by Friday.
Snow is possible in the mountains tonight.
A promotion is possible with hard work.
She’s a possible candidate for the role.
It’s possible he misunderstood the instructions.
The waiter will serve dinner at 7 p.m.

back_cards.definition_en: To perform a duty or role
back_cards.example_en: She served as mayor for two terms.
The staff served the customers promptly.
The company serves rural areas with internet.

back_cards.definition_en: To spend time in a role
back_cards.example_en: He served three years in the military.
She didn’t mean to break the glass.
Let’s break for lunch at noon.

back_cards.definition_en: To violate a rule or promise
back_cards.example_en: He broke the law by speeding.
She broke the school’s track record.

back_cards.definition_en: To end a relationship or situation
back_cards.example_en: They decided to break their partnership.
Although it rained, the picnic went on.
She smiled, although she was tired.
Although he tried, he couldn’t solve the puzzle.
Although the movie was long, it was engaging.
Although I disagree, I respect your opinion.

back_cards.definition_en: A place where goods are sold
back_cards.example_en: She bought fresh fruit at the market.
The market for electric cars is growing.
The market crashed after the news.
Their product targets the youth market.
The company entered the global market.
The mountain air was fresh and clean.
The plane soared through the air.
She carried an air of confidence.
The song was played on the air.
He whistled a cheerful air.
The force of the wind knocked down trees.
The air force conducted a training mission.
Her argument had the force of logic.

back_cards.definition_en: A push or pull in physics
back_cards.example_en: Gravity is a force that affects all objects.
They used force to open the stuck door.
The jar contains homemade jam.
The book contains useful information.
She tried to contain her excitement.
The fence contains the animals in the yard.
The report contains several key findings.

back_cards.definition_en: The lower part of the leg
back_cards.example_en: Her foot hurt after the long hike.
The room is ten feet wide.
The statue stands at the foot of the hill.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a poem’s rhythm
back_cards.example_en: The poem’s meter has five feet per line.
He sat at the foot of the bed.
She loves to listen to music in the evening.
Listen carefully to the instructions.
He didn’t listen to her warnings.
The teacher asked the students to listen.
They listen to podcasts during their commute.
We agree on the need for change.
She agreed to help with the event.
They agreed on a fair price.
His story doesn’t agree with the facts.
The climate here agrees with her health.
According to the news, it might rain.
The plan was made according to her wishes.
The budget was set according to sales data.
Salaries are adjusted according to experience.
According to the report, profits increased.
Does anyone know the answer?
Anyone can join the club.
Is anyone home right now?
Did anyone see my keys?
Anyone interested can sign up.
The baby slept through the night.
He called her baby as a sweet nickname.
The zoo welcomed a baby elephant.

back_cards.definition_en: The youngest member of a group
back_cards.example_en: She’s the baby of the team.
This is the baby version of the car model.
His answer was wrong on the test.
It’s wrong to lie about the situation.
She wore the wrong shoes for hiking.
Something is wrong with the printer.
It was wrong to blame him alone.

back_cards.definition_en: To divide with a sharp tool
back_cards.example_en: She cut the cake into slices.
They cut the budget by ten percent.
He cut his hair for the summer.
The director cut the scene from the film.
The harsh words cut her deeply.

back_cards.definition_en: To make a choice or judgment
back_cards.example_en: She decided to move to a new city.
The jury decided the case in her favor.
We need to decide on a vacation spot.
The vote will decide the winner.

back_cards.definition_en: To commit to a course of action
back_cards.example_en: He decided to pursue a new career.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of the Republican Party
back_cards.example_en: The Republican won the election by a narrow margin.
She identifies as a Republican and votes accordingly.

back_cards.definition_en: A person favoring a republic government
back_cards.example_en: The Republican advocated for democratic reforms.

back_cards.definition_en: A candidate from the Republican Party
back_cards.example_en: The Republican debated tax policies on TV.
He joined the Republican committee in his town.
The glass was full of water.
She worked a full eight-hour shift.
The meal was full of flavor.
I’m full after that big lunch.
He gave his full attention to the task.
The car was parked behind the house.
She’s behind on her assignments.
The team is behind their coach.
They’re behind in technology development.
He was behind the successful campaign.
The car passed the truck on the highway.
She passed the math test with ease.
Please pass the salt.
The council passed the new law.

back_cards.definition_en: To go by, as in time
back_cards.example_en: Hours passed while they talked.

back_cards.definition_en: A feeling of curiosity or engagement
back_cards.example_en: Her interest in science grew in school.
Photography is one of his interests.
He has an interest in the company.
The bank pays interest on deposits.
It’s in our interest to collaborate.
She sometimes works late to finish tasks.

back_cards.definition_en: Not always but now and then
back_cards.example_en: It sometimes rains in the afternoon.
He sometimes visits his grandparents.
They sometimes argue over small things.
Sometimes, silence is the best response.
The airport increased security after the alert.
She felt security in her stable job.
The building has tight security cameras.
He invested in government securities.
The treaty ensured regional security.
They eat breakfast together every morning.
Let’s eat at the new restaurant tonight.
The repairs ate into their savings.
He ate the apple in a few bites.
Rust ate away at the old car.

back_cards.definition_en: A detailed account of an event
back_cards.example_en: The news report covered the storm’s impact.
She submitted a report to her boss.
His school report showed excellent grades.
The weather report predicted rain.
The police report detailed the incident.

back_cards.definition_en: The power to direct or manage
back_cards.example_en: She took control of the project.
The remote is the control for the TV.
The city imposed traffic control measures.
The experiment included a control group.
He lost control during the debate.

back_cards.definition_en: A measure of frequency or speed
back_cards.example_en: The heart rate monitor beeped steadily.
The hotel charges a nightly rate.

back_cards.definition_en: A level of quality or performance
back_cards.example_en: She’s a first-rate chef.
The success rate of the program was high.
Crime rates dropped this year.
The local shop sells handmade goods.
She joined the local book club.
The issue was a local concern.
The local news covered the festival.
He supports the local sports team.

back_cards.definition_en: To propose an idea or plan
back_cards.example_en: She suggested a new meeting time.
His tone suggested he was upset.
I suggest trying the pasta dish.
The smell suggested fresh rain.
He suggested a different approach.

back_cards.definition_en: A country with its own government
back_cards.example_en: The nation celebrated its independence day.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of people with shared culture
back_cards.example_en: The festival united the nation in joy.
The nation voted on the new policy.
The entire nation watched the game.
Their nation is known for its art.
She plans to sell her old car.
The store sells organic produce.
He sold the idea to the team.
They sell their brand through social media.
The new phone model sells quickly.
Her quick action saved the day.
The team is ready for action.
He filed an action against the company.
The movie was full of action scenes.
The action of the machine was smooth.
She offered support during his recovery.
The crowd gave support to the team.
The bridge’s support was reinforced.
The charity provides support for families.
The data gave support to her theory.
His wife planned a surprise party.
The couple’s wife is a talented artist.
He consulted his wife before deciding.

back_cards.definition_en: A woman in a committed relationship
back_cards.example_en: The sailor missed his wife during the voyage.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for a close female partner
back_cards.example_en: She’s been his wife for twenty years.
Her decision to move was difficult.
The decision took hours of discussion.
The court’s decision was final.
His decision to study abroad was bold.
The decision on funding was delayed.

back_cards.definition_en: To get or be given something
back_cards.example_en: She received a gift for her birthday.
The radio received a clear signal.
He received praise for his work.
They received guests at the event.
We received news about the project.
The value of the house increased.
Her advice has great value to me.
Honesty is a core value of theirs.
The value of x in the equation is 5.
The course offers good value for money.
The statue stands on a stone base.
The military base was heavily guarded.
Her argument used facts as a base.
The soup has a tomato base.
The city is a base for tourists.
She picked a red apple from the tree.
They pick flowers in the garden.
He picked a splinter from his finger.
Don’t pick a fight with him.
The thief learned to pick locks.
She answered the phone after two rings.
His phone has the latest apps.
The office phone was always busy.
I left my phone at home.
The phone connected them across continents.
She gave her thanks for the help.
He sent a note of thanks after the party.
Thanks for holding the door open.
Her thanks went to the whole team.
Thanks for the lovely gift.
The charity event raised a lot of money.
The crash was a tragic event.
Her graduation was a major event.
He won first place in the track event.
The event marked a turning point.
She drives to work every morning.
Ambition drives her to succeed.
The storm drove them indoors.
He drives the project with passion.
They drove across the country for vacation.
He’s strong enough to lift the box.
The bridge is strong and safe.
A strong wind blew through the valley.
The medicine has a strong effect.
She has a strong will to succeed.
They reached the summit by noon.
She reached for the book on the shelf.
He reached his goal of running a marathon.
You can reach me by email.
Her speech reached the hearts of many.
She remained calm during the crisis.
Only a few tickets remain for the show.
The problem remains unsolved.
He remained at home all weekend.
The ruins remain as a historical site.
She explained the rules to the new players.
He explained why he was late.
The teacher explained the math problem step-by-step.
Can you explain how this app works?
She explained her decision to the team.
The heat of the summer was intense.
The oven’s heat cooked the bread.
He felt the heat of the tight deadline.
She won her heat in the swimming race.
The fireplace provided heat for the room.
